gen_report_countries: Select the countries to include in the document (maximum 6)
gen_report_regions_country: Select a country to show turning points and recession/slowdown regions on the chart
gen_report_clocks_time: Select a month for the clocks
customeRange_selection_info: You can set below from what month/year display the data.
show_info_button: View information about the Business Cycle Clock
A_description: the growth rate slips below the trend
D_description: the growth rate overpass the trend
move_mouse_on_clock_tip: Move your mouse on the clock for more information.
right_quadrands_description: The right quadrants (from points α to β) show a decrease in the growth rate.
left_quadrands_description: The left quadrants (from points β to α) show a increase in the growth rate.
quadrant_upright_description: In the first quadrant, between α and A, growth is positive; the growth rate decreases, but still above trend.
quadrant_bottomright_slowdown_descriptio: In the second quadrant the growth rate decreases and is below trend, but remains positive to point B.
quadrant_bottomright_recession_descripti: In the second quadrant the growth rate decreases and is below trend, it is negative from the point B and reaches a minimum at the point β.
quadrant_bottomleft_recession_descriptio: In the third quadrant the growth rate is increasing, but remains below trend and remains negative to point C.
quadrant_bottomleft_slowdown_description: In the third quadrant the growth rate is increasing, but remains below trend; it becomes positive from the point C.
quadrant_bottomleft_description: In the fourth quadrant growth is positive, the growth rate increases and is higher than the trend.
chart_gdp_gc_title: GDP growth cycle as a percentage of deviation from the trend
chart_gdp_gc_description: as a percentage of deviation from the trend
embed_explanation: To embed the BC on another web page, just copy this code.
mouse_over_for_data: Move your mouse over a country for more information
meta.description: Business Cycle Clock for Euro Area
bcc_tool_details: The Business Cycle Clock (BCC) is a tool showing different economic cycle phases for the euro area using a clock-type graph. The clock is structured to represent the empirically observed sequence of turning points of the business, growth and acceleration cycles.
bcc_tool_user_manual: Please see the user manual for more information on how to use the tool and the Statistics Explain article on the BCC for more information on its methodology.
pdf_compatibility_issue_explanation: Pdf generation feature is not available on Internet Explorer 9, please update or use an alternative browser.
features_mainview_description: The main view let you select up to six countries you’re interesting to compare from the Euro Area.
features_mainview_detail_1: The linear graph shows you a global view of the evolution of the situation of the selected countries during time.
features_mainview_detail_2: On the bottom part appear the cycle clock of each of the selected countries, providing the precise cyclic situation for each of them.
features_mapview_description: The map view give a global way the vizualize on a map the economic situation of the different countries covered by the BCC : Euro Area.
features_PDFreport_description_1: The PDF report generation feature let you save a PDF document on your computer with all the same interesting data and charts that you saw on the BCC website.
features_PDFreport_description_2: You can customize the content if the document by choosing the countries, the time period … etc.
report_def_aA_1: In the first sector the growth is positive, the growth rate decreases but stay above the trend.
report_def_AB_1: In the second sector the growth rate decreases and is below trend, but remains positive until point B.
report_def_Bb_1: In the third sector, the growth rate decreases,
report_def_Bb_2: it is negative starting from point B and reach a minimum at point beta.
report_def_bC_1: In the fourth sector, the growth rate increses but remains below the trend and remains negative until point C.
report_def_CD_1: In the fift sector, the growth rate increases and become positive at point C but remain below the trend.
report_def_Da_1: In the sixth sector, the growth is positive, the growth rate increases and is higher thant the trend.
chart_slowdown: A slowdown is a period in which the growth rate is positive and below the trend.
chart_recession: A recession is a period in which the growth rate is negative.
chart_A: A : the growth rate slips below the trend
chart_D: D : the growth rate overpass the trend
triangle_details: The triangle at the bottom moves on a monthly scale while the circle in the plot line moves on a quarterly scale.
periods_details: The slowdown and recession periods as well as the turning points are shown for either the euro area or the last selected country.
